text: Money from the CARES Act was meant to help low-income students and the schools that serve them. So, why did the CARES Act give more money to hair schools than to a community college? https://t.co/RXn3RL2eoO (1/8) #NBCNewsThreads

name: NBCNews
text:
Houston Community College and the Paul Mitchell Schools both got financial relief.

The Houston college, a public i… https://t.co/fzERTWl6lu

name: NBCNews
text:
In fact, almost 9% of the coronavirus relief package money for higher education went to for-profit schools, NBC News has found, despite only serving 5.4% of students.

Community colleges, by contrast, got 22% even though they serve 32% of students. https://t.co/RXn3RLjPgm (4/8)

name: NBCNews
text:
The reason for the disparity is the formula Congress came up with to spend the money.

Community colleges offer man… https://t.co/5vmVmf0fcw

name: NBCNews
text:
But they came up short in the formula, because about 64% of community college students attend part time.

“The form… https://t.co/UazKzvAxgH

name: NBCNews
text: “The for-profits know that how they use the money is going to be scrutinized,” Robert Kelchen, an associate profess… https://t.co/h20r3rAb5X
